text: William Todd Akin (July 5, 1947 â€“ October 3, 2021) was an American politician and businessman. He was the U.S. Representative for from 2001 to 2013. He was a member of the Republican Party. In 1988, he was elected to the Missouri House of Representatives. He left office in 2000, when he was elected to the United States House of Representatives. Akin was the Republican nominee for the United States Senate running against Democratic U.S. Senator Claire McCaskill in the 2012 election. He lost the election because he said that women who are victims of what he called "legitimate rape" rarely get pregnant. Akin eventually apologized for the remark. In 2014, he defended his comments and regretted apologizing for them. In April 2001, Akin had surgery for early- stage prostate cancer. He died from cancer on October 3, 2021 in Wildwood, Missouri at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2021 deaths Category:United States representatives from Missouri Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Businesspeople from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Cancer deaths in Missouri Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Politicians from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Members of the Missouri General Assembly
